title: Museo Sans release
content:
[[http://www.josbuivenga.demon.nl/museosans.html|Museo Sans]] has been released. It comes in 10 styles: five weights with each an italic. Two styles (500 & 500 italic) are free. [Available at MyFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203032658/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/exljbris/museo-sans/).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203032658im_/http:/typophile.com/files/museo_sans_2_4309.png)
author: Jos Buivenga

comments.content:
Nice.

Looking at it I keep thinking ‘the other Avenir’ (‘other’ meaning nice alternative).
Really cool! I do have a postcard which I was thinking to hand set the back side. Now looking at Museo 500 I think I am going to use it instead. Re-que-congrats!

That's a great compliment, Jan. Thanks.

Nice, André. Keep me posted :-)

Museo Sans is featured in [MyFonts Rising Stars October 2008](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203032658/http:/www.myfonts.com/newsletters/rs/200810.html).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203032658im_/http:/typophile.com/files/rs-200810_4381.png)
I love Museo but the Sans version is just another Frutiger/Myriad for me :(
I guess it all depends on how you look at it. Glad you like Museo.

"Only for a day ;-)" LOL! (literally)

That was great Jos... I absoulutely love Museo, when you released the sample, I adopted it as my corporate font, not knowing that it was going to be more popular than helvetica, even if if is just for a day, dude... that is frickin' awesome. Well done, thanks and keep up all your hard work... Can't wait to see what's next!

—Justin
Thank you, Justin! If you want to keep track of my new releases be sure to subscribe to my [blog's feed](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203032658/http:/exljbris.wordpress.com/feed/).

I'm proud that Museo and Museo Sans are featured in the latest MyFonts newsletter " [Top 10 fonts of 2008](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203032658/http:/new.myfonts.com/newsletters/sp/200901.html)". They even mention my marketing strategy ;-)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203032658im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mf_2008_3532.gif)
Congratulations on having your awesomeness recognized! (and on the success of Museo…)

And now Museo has been used in [an article about type design](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203032658/http:/ilovetypography.com/2009/01/14/inconspicuous-vertical-metrics/#more-4002). Does that make it a new classic?
I wondered at that myself. I was suprised to see Museo in that article. I guess it's other people who make Museo a classic, not me ;-)
